text: I like Caan Berry because if someone’s winning someone else has to be losing, he’s generating lots of losers.

elements.text: I like Caan Berry because if someone’s winning someone else has to be losing, he’s generating lots of losers.

text: It is an unpalatable truth but you are right. Tony Hargraves is a truly odious character and total conman but the shit that he sells clearly pulls new people into the IP horse markets. Personally I don't get the allure of manual trading at all and as a consequence I cannot understand why so many try to go into it. I mean, fine if you can turn 6 figure tax free profits a year but even then I think I would rather earn half that in a "real" job than sitting on my arse 6 hours a day watching ladders. I just don't get the appeal unless you would make serious money.

elements.text: It is an unpalatable truth but you are right. Tony Hargraves is a truly odious character and total conman but the shit that he sells clearly pulls new people into the IP horse markets. Personally I don't get the allure of manual trading at all and as a consequence I cannot understand why so many try to go into it. I mean, fine if you can turn 6 figure tax free profits a year but even then I think I would rather earn half that in a "real" job than sitting on my arse 6 hours a day watching ladders. I just don't get the appeal unless you would make serious money.

text: Re Caan, Ive met him at a few of the betfair events over the years and we even did some work together at one point. He is a very genuine guy ( i sat next to him when he was manually trading, his profits are real). However you want to view it, he does sell courses. He is no automation expert though. I think if you met him at one of our meet ups, he would come across as a nice bloke. One thing I can tell you, he has put MANY hours and study into what he does.

elements.text: Re Caan, Ive met him at a few of the betfair events over the years and we even did some work together at one point. He is a very genuine guy ( i sat next to him when he was manually trading, his profits are real). However you want to view it, he does sell courses. He is no automation expert though. I think if you met him at one of our meet ups, he would come across as a nice bloke. One thing I can tell you, he has put MANY hours and study into what he does.

text: What kind of scale do you think the good manual traders like Caan operate at? Mid six figures per year?

text: I’ve always thought of him as someone who made money a few years ago when it was easier but now makes his money from selling courses. Manual trading seems very labour intensive and stressful.
